intro: Astragalus turolensis var. exsul, commonly known as the Turol's milkvetch, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant has small, compound leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often growing in gravelly soils and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
